snippet.textDisplay:
I really cannot say just how emotionally beautiful this trilogy is.
I started this Saga after beating Xenoblade Chronicles X, and began the long endeavor of watching all the cutscenes, and buying all the games in this trilogy.

Xenosaga III is by far one of the most emotional games for me, nearly every scene is an earthquake of emotions for me, knowing that it's the final game in the series.

Every character, every track, every single scene is just so beautiful from the Brawl with T-Elos and KOS-MOS, to the reveal of the Gnosis' existence, to the final moments at Zarathustra, this game had me crying really hard.

This track is by far the perfect summary of the entire series. And it by itself would be the only reason I'd ever buy a Xenosaga Trilogy Remaster. This track is just so beautiful, I'd die to hear it remastered.

snippet.textDisplay:
Coming back here helps me cry everything out. Within the last 2 weeks, a man I respect and enjoyed watching on YouTube, Ronnie Edwards(Also Game Theory's Editor) committed suicide. Just 4 days from 7/31/2018 when I'm writing this, one of my closest friends lost his brother to an ATV accident. I haven't been able to respond very well in a way that would make him feel better. And my older brother's friend is coming home from his LDS Mission after 2 months(a full term is supposed to be 2 years) due to depression, and I can't tell how well my brother is taking it, since his birthday was 3 days ago and last year on his birthday, Chester Bennington(Linkin Park Frontman) also passed away. 
I'm sorry for taking up anyone's attention, I just wanted to tell @SupraDarky that this upload has helped me let out some bottling up emotions that probably wouldn't help me in the future. Whoever else reads this, it's never a bad thing to cry. I've had a pretty heavy month, but this song has helped me vent a little bit. Thanks, @SupraDarky.
Thank you, Yuki Kajiura, for creating this masterpiece.

snippet.textDisplay: Xenosaga is 100 times better then Xenogears
snippet.textOriginal: Xenosaga is 100 times better then Xenogears

snippet.textDisplay:
Xenogears was a fucking mess of a game. The second disk was 80% floating still images and text, and the story it explained rendered everything that happened in disk 1 (i/e the shit you actually played through) almost completely irrelevant. I have no idea why people admire that game so much; I can only guess that they liked the faux-deep grandiosity of the story so much that it led them to  disregard how glaringly it failed to achieve being a "game" on even the most basic level.
Xenosaga had a similar problem, too much story for the three games they ended up making (and seriously, who the fuck plans to do a six-part RPG? These people are walking ego trips, and it shows). The jump between 2 and 3 is very awkward and you can only understand the dialogue if you read pages and pages of codex entries.
BUT, at least they are GAMES that you proceed through by PLAYING THEM. Yeah, 1 had dated and generic turn-based RPG mechanics, and 2 was an awkward larval version of 3, but at no point in either is the entire experience reduced to that of a glorified e-book, the way FUCKING HALF OF XENOGEARS WAS.
People who think Xenogears was better are fucking clinically retarded. 9 out of 10 doctors agree, and the tenth died of boredom trying to finish Xenogears.
Oh and before you go wagging your finger about how Xenogears is deeper or how it's like a novel or whatever: WRONG. Read an actual novel and you will immediately understand the vast  and inevitable difference in quality  between a book that was intentionally created as a book, and a video game that accidentally turned into one halfway through because of budgetary constraints. The story in xenogears is shoddy, bloated, self-indulgent white fucking noise, and it would only have potentially worked if it were used, as originally intended, as a means of enriching a gameplay experience. As a series of dull cutscenes punctuated by the occasional half-assed hallway dungeon or boss fight, it was just tedious nonsense that should never have been released.

snippet.textDisplay: For being such a packed game story-wise, they pulled it off better than I could've imagined. I learned about the state of Monolith at that point before I actually started playing it. The final chapter was still really good. I came here because of all the connections between this and Xenoblade. I kept telling myself "I probably like this better because I haven't played it over 8 times yet." I was lying to myself. I genuinely like this better than Xenoblade. I just hope the story continues at some point. Takahashi even said himself that he would like to make more if he got legal rights and financial backing.

snippet.textDisplay: i wish more fantasy rpg games were being created, PS2 really centered on that kind of game genre(my favorite). snippet.textDisplay: Actually, Ep. III (or the real Ep. II) ended the way it was supposed to, since that was the end of Shion's arc. In the original plan, a new arc would begin in the next two episodes (obviously, we see that plan went awry). Long story short, Shion's arc ends in Ep. III, and new one would begin if a new game was to be made, complete with new characters, with the exception of KOS-MOS and chaos
